Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the game's graphical user interface. Manages UI components, rendering, input handling, game loop, and state transitions. Implements Initializable to set up the FXML-injected components.

      public GuiController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the GUI controller. Called automatically by JavaFX after FXML loading. Sets up fonts, focus handling, and initial visibility states.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - the location used to resolve relative paths, or null if unknown
      resources - the resources used to localize the root object, or null if not localized

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the game view with the board matrix and initial brick data. Sets up the board renderer, input handler, and game loop.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the initial game board matrix
      brick - the initial falling brick data

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the display of the current falling brick.
      Parameters:
      brick - the updated brick data to display

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the game board background display.
      Parameters:
      board - the updated board matrix to render

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Sets the input event listener to handle game logic events.
      Parameters:
      eventListener - the InputEventListener to receive events

    • bindScore

      public void bindScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty integerProperty)
      Binds the score label to the score property for automatic UI updates.
      Parameters:
      integerProperty - the score property to bind

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Handles the game over state. Stops the game loop and timer, displays the game over panel, and transitions to GameOverState.

    • newGame

      public void newGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Starts a new game. Resets the game loop, clears UI overlays, resets sprint mode if active, and initializes a new game through the event listener.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event that triggered this method (from UI button)

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Toggles the pause state of the game. If playing, pauses the game. If paused, resumes the game. Does nothing if the game is over.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event that triggered this method (from UI button or key press)

    • bindHighScore

      public void bindHighScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty highScoreProperty)
      Binds the high score label to the high score property for automatic UI updates.
      Parameters:
      highScoreProperty - the high score property to bind

    • updateGameSpeed

      public void updateGameSpeed(int speedMs)
      Updates the game loop speed based on the current level.
      Parameters:
      speedMs - the new speed in milliseconds (time between ticks)

    • bindLevel

      public void bindLevel(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty levelProperty)
      Binds the level label to the level property for automatic UI updates. Only binds if sprint mode is not active.
      Parameters:
      levelProperty - the level property to bind

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Resumes the game from paused state. Transitions from PausedState to PlayingState and hides the pause overlay.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event that triggered this method (from UI button)

    • exitToHome

      public void exitToHome(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Exits the game view and returns to the home screen. Stops the game loop and loads the home screen FXML.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event that triggered this method (from UI button)

    • updateNextPiecesPreview

      public void updateNextPiecesPreview(int[][] next1, int[][] next2)
      Updates the preview panels to show the next two upcoming bricks.
      Parameters:
      next1 - the matrix representation of the first next brick
      next2 - the matrix representation of the second next brick

    • setSprintMode

      public void setSprintMode(int target)
      Sets up sprint mode with the specified target number of lines to clear. Hides high score display, shows timer, and displays sprint notification.
      Parameters:
      target - the target number of lines to clear in sprint mode

    • updateSprintProgress

      public void updateSprintProgress(int linesCleared, int target)
      Updates the sprint progress display showing lines cleared vs target.
      Parameters:
      linesCleared - the number of lines cleared so far
      target - the target number of lines to clear

    • gameWon

      public void gameWon()
      Handles the sprint mode win condition. Stops the game loop and timer, displays the win message with completion time, and transitions to GameOverState.
